text:
A Silent Encounter

Two men walk side by side, tension rising.  
Raskolnikov: “You were inquiring for me… of the porter?”  

The man looks away, silence thickens.  

Raskolnikov: “Why do you come and ask for me?”  
Raskolnikov: “What’s the meaning of it?”  

The man suddenly turns, eyes dark.  
Man: “Murderer!”  

---  

Raskolnikov's legs weaken, heart races.  
Raskolnikov: “What do you mean… who is a murderer?”  

Man: “You are a murderer.”  
Man: “You know it.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov encounters a man who accuses him of being a murderer, intensifying his feelings of guilt and fear.
